intro: Uragoga undata, commonly known as the creeping marsh grass, is a herbaceous plant native to wetland and marsh environments. It features slender,匍匐的 stems that root at the nodes, allowing it to spread across the ground. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically arranged in spikes and bloom in the early to mid-summer. Uragoga undata plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wetland organisms.
